definition: to rotate/to circulate (cash, stock etc)/turnover/circulation/cash flow
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to have a cash flow problem
to have financial difficulties/unable to make ends meet

sentences.english: Worker mobility gives the tech industry fluidity, velocity, and energy.
sentences.chinese: 员工流动赋予科技产业流动性，周转性和能量。

sentences.english: The money mechanism began to work stiffly and inaccurately.
sentences.chinese: 贷币机构开始周转不灵和不准确了。

sentences.english: It represents the average rate that a balance of inventory is turned in one year.
sentences.chinese: 指库存额在一年中的平均周转率。

sentences.english: Circulation areas and storage areas will be indicated on the site installation drawing.
sentences.chinese: 周转区域和仓储区域需在现场安装图上指明。

sentences.english: I am just worrying about the working capital.
sentences.chinese: 我还正为周转资金发愁哪。
低成本，快速的周转时间。

sentences.english: Studying on the leaf tissue turnover of Smooth bromegrass was reported.
sentences.chinese: 对无芒雀麦叶组织物质周转进行了研究。

sentences.english: There are so three Tashan at, physically care for of Di two wives also not turnover.
sentences.chinese: 有这么三座大山在，实际管事的狄二太太也不好周转。

sentences.english: Liquidity risk is the risk of not being able to meet commitments due to a shortage of cash.
sentences.chinese: 周转风险是指因缺乏现金而不能支付承付款项的风险。

sentences.english: That way it will be there when you need some working capital.
sentences.chinese: 这样将有当你需要一些周转资金。

sentences.english: The people, who now have more money available, are beginning to enter into a material consumer culture.
sentences.chinese: 拥有更多周转资金的人们正步入物质消费的文化当中。

sentences.english: The crucial passage comes in Chapter 17 entitled "Velocity".
sentences.chinese: 关键的段落在第17章，题为“周转率”。

sentences.english: This policy is based on the experience of the RDF within Khartoum state.
sentences.chinese: 该政策依据的是喀土穆州的药品周转基金经验。

sentences.english: The turn-over at that discount store is very rapid.
sentences.chinese: 这个折扣店货物周转很快。

sentences.english: There is simply too much money circulating in China, which is fueling inflation and over-investment.
sentences.chinese: 有太多钱在中国周转，助长了通胀和过度投资。

sentences.english: Captial turnover is a periodical cycle.
sentences.chinese: 资本周转是周期性的循环。

definition: to have a cash flow problem
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
